quest_title: If the roots of the equations \(px^{2} +2qx+r=0\) and \(qx^{2} -2\sqrt{pr} x+q=0\) be real, then
explanation_txt:
Equations \(px^{2} +2qx+r=0\) and \(qx^{2} -2(\sqrt{pr} )x+q=0\) have real roots, then from first

\(4q^{2} -4pr\ge 0\)\(\Rightarrow \) \(q^{2} -pr\ge 0\, \, \Rightarrow q^{2} \ge pr\) .....(i)

and from second \(4(pr)-4q^{2} \ge 0\)(for real root )

\(\Rightarrow \)\(pr\ge q^{2} \) .....(ii)

From (i) and (ii), we get result \(q^{2} =pr\).
question_plain_title: If the roots of the equations and be real, then
explanation_plain_text:
Equations and have real roots, then from first

.....(i)

and from second (for real root )

.....(ii)

From (i) and (ii), we get result .

quest_title: The projection of a line on a co-ordinate axes are 2, 3, 6. Then the length of the line is
explanation_txt:
Let \(\textit{d}\) be the length of line, then projection on \(X\) axis is \(dl = 2\), projection on \(Y\) axis is \(dm=3\), projection on \(Z\) axis is \(dn = 6 \).

\(d^{2} (l^{2} +m^{2} +n^{2} )=4+9+36\)

\(\Rightarrow d^{2} (1)=49 \)

\( \Rightarrow d=7. \)

quest_title: If the rate of increase of area of a circle is not constant but the rate of increase of perimeter is constant, then the rate of increase of area varies
explanation_txt: \(\begin{array} { l } { \text { Perimeter } P = 2 \pi r } \\ { \cfrac { d P } { d t } = 2 \pi \cdot \cfrac { d r } { d t } \text { and } A = \pi r ^ { 2 } } \\ { \cfrac { d A } { d t } = 2 \pi r \cdot \cfrac { d r } { d t } \Rightarrow \cfrac { d A } { d t } = \cfrac { d P } { d t } \times r \Rightarrow \cfrac { d A } { d t } \propto r } \end{array}\)

quest_title: It is possible for a substance to coexist in all three phases in equilibrium, when the substance is at
explanation_txt:
Triple point of a substance is the temperature and pressure at which the three phases (gas, liquid, and solid) of that substance coexist in thermodynamic equilibrium.

The value of triple point of water is 0.01 \(^{\circ} C\) and 611.2 \(Pa\).

quest_title: Four metallic plates of each with a surface area of one side \(\text{A}\), are placed at a distance \(\text{d}\) from each other. The alternate plates are connected to points \(\text{A}\) and \(\text{B}\). The equivalent capacitance of the system will be
explanation_txt:
The connected plates act as a single conductor. So, effectively there are two capacitors connected in parallel. The capacity of each capacitor is given by
\(C=\cfrac{\varepsilon_0 A}{d}\)
Hence, net capacitance between \(A\) and \(B\) is given by:
\(C_{A B}=C+C=\cfrac{3 \varepsilon_0 A}{d}\)

quest_title:
Consider the equilibrium at 760 K 
 \(\text{PCl\(_{5}\)}\) \(\leftrightharpoons\) \(\text{PCl\(_{3}\)}\) + \(\text{Cl\(_{2}\)}\) 
 4.0 moles of \(\text{PCl\(_{5}\)}\) are taken in a 2 litre flask and at equilibrium the flask is found to contain 0.80 mole of \(\text{Cl\(_{2}\).}\) What is the equilibrium constant ?
explanation_txt:
Concentration of \(PCl_5\) is \(4/2 = 2\) moles per litre.

Given:

\(\begin{matrix} PCl_5 & \leftrightharpoons & PCl_3 & + & Cl_2 \\ 2 & & 0 & & 0 \\ x & & 2-x & & 2-x \end{matrix}\)

Also, as given:

\(2-x=\cfrac{0.8}{2} = 0.4 \\ \Rightarrow x = 1.6\)

So,

\(\begin{align} K_c & = \cfrac{[PCl_3][Cl_2]}{[PCl_5]} \\ & = \cfrac{0.4 \times 0.4}{1.6} \\ & = 0.1 \end{align}\)

quest_title: A siren placed at a railway platform is emitting sound of frequency 5KHz. A passenger sitting in the moving train "A" records a frequency of 5.5KHz while the train approaching the siren. During the return journey in different train 'B' be records a frequency of 6.0KHz while approaching the same siren. The ratio of velocity of train B to that the train A is
explanation_txt:
When observer approaches the stationary source than the apparent frequency is given by:
\(f^{1}=\left(\cfrac{v+v_{0}}{v}\right) \times f \Rightarrow \cfrac{\Delta f}{f}=\cfrac{v_{o}}{v}\)
for train \(A\)
\(\cfrac{V_{A}}{V}=\cfrac{5.5-5}{5}=\cfrac{0.5}{5}\)
For train \(\mathrm{B}\)
\(\begin{array}{l}{\cfrac{V_{\mathrm{B}}}{V}=\cfrac{6-5}{5}=\cfrac{1}{5}} \\ {\cfrac{V_{\mathrm{B}}}{V_{\mathrm{A}}}=\cfrac{1}{0.5}=2}\end{array}\)

A passenger sitting in the moving train "A" records a frequency of 5.5KHz while the train approaching the siren. During the return journey in different train 'B' be records a frequency of 6.0KHz while approaching the same siren. The ratio of velocity of train B to that the train A is
explanation_plain_text:
When observer approaches the stationary source than the apparent frequency is given by:

for train

quest_title: The equation of the circle which touches x-axis and whose centre is (1, 2), is:
explanation_txt:
Centre (1, 2) and since circle touches x-axis, therefore, radius is equal to 2.

Hence the equation is: \(( x - 1 ) ^ { 2 } + ( y - 2 ) ^ { 2 } = 2 ^ { 2 }\)

\(\Rightarrow x ^ { 2 } + y ^ { 2 } - 2 x - 4 y + 1 = 0\)

[The only circle is \(x ^ { 2 } + y ^ { 2 } - 2 x - 4 y + 1 = 0\), whose centre is (1, 2)]

quest_title: The correct order of second ionization energies of carbon, nitrogen, oxygen and fluorine is
explanation_txt:
Generally ionization energy increases on moving left to right across the periodic table.

But due to stable half filled configuration of oxygen in second ionization state, it has higher second ionization energy than fluorine.

quest_title: On which of the following scales of temperature, the temperature is never negative
explanation_txt: Zero kelvin \(= - 273 ^ { \circ } C\) (absolute temperature). As no matter can attain this temperature, hence temperature can never be negative on Kelvin scale.
question_plain_title: On which of the following scales of temperature, the temperature is never negative
explanation_plain_text: Zero kelvin (absolute temperature). As no matter can attain this temperature, hence temperature can never be negative on Kelvin scale.

quest_title: Amount of heat required to raise the temperature of a body through 1K is called its
explanation_txt: \( Q = m . c . \Delta \theta ; \text { if } \Delta \theta = 1 K \text { then } Q = m c = \text { Thermal } \text { capacity. } \)

quest_title: If the molecular weight of two gases are \(\textit{M}\)\({}_{1}\) and \(\textit{M}\)\({}_{2}\), then at a temperature the ratio of root mean square velocity \(\textit{v}\)\({}_{1}\) and \(\textit{v}\)\({}_{2}\) will be
explanation_txt:
Pressure exerted by a gas \[
P=\cfrac{1}{3} \rho v_{r m s}^{2}
\]

\[
\Rightarrow v_{rms}=\sqrt{\cfrac{3 P}{\rho}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{3 P V}{\text { Mass of gas }}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{3 R T}{M}}
\]

\[\therefore v_{rms} \propto \cfrac{1}{\sqrt{M}}\]

i.e. \(\cfrac{v_{1}}{v_{2}}=\cfrac{\sqrt{M_{2}}}{\sqrt{M_{1}}}\)

quest_title: A boy stands straight infront of a mirror at a distance of 30 cm away from it. He sees his erect image whose height \(\cfrac{1}{5}th\) is of his real height. The mirror he is using is
explanation_txt: Size is \(\cfrac{1}{5}\) It can’t be plane and concave mirror, because both conditions are not satisfied in plane or concave mirror. Convex mirror can meet all the requirements.

quest_title: The number of words which can be formed from the letters of the word MAXIMUM, if two consonants cannot occur together, is:
explanation_txt:
The vowels are: \( V = \{A,I,U\} \)

No. of arrangements \( = 3! \)

and, the consonants are: \( C = \{M,X,M,M\} \)

No. of arrangements \( = \cfrac{4!}{3!} = 4\) [3 M's are identical]

No two vowels can come together and no arrangement begins from a vowel. Else, at least two consonants would come together.

So, the arrangement is equivalent to arranging vowels and consonants separately. Hence, \( n = 3! \times 4 = 4! \)

C V C V

C

 V C
